title: President Dissanayake meets German President Frank-Walter Steinmeier
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, who is on an official visit to the Federal Republic of Germany, has met with German President Mr. Frank-Walter Steinmeier today (11) at Bellevue Palace in Berlin.

title: Committee report on Gerandi Ella bus accident handed over to Minister
byline: The report of the special investigative committee appointed to probe the tragic bus accident that claimed the lives of 23 individuals in Gerandi Ella, Ramboda, has been handed over to the Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs today (June 11).

title: Tony Blair Institute to provide financial and technical assistance for four key institutions in Sri Lanka
byline: A discussion between Dr Nandika Sanath Kumanayake, Secretary to the President and officials of the Tony Blair Institute for Global Change was held today (11) at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: Children swept away in school bus among at least 49 killed in South Africa flooding
byline: At least 49 people are confirmed dead after flooding hit South Africa, including children whose school bus was swept away during the extreme weather, officials said.

title: Railway parcels acceptance for Kandy-Matale line suspended
byline: Due to the ground subsidence of a section of the railway line between Kandy and Peradeniya, the acceptance of parcels for transport by trains on the Kandy and Matale line has been temporarily suspended.

title: President Dissanayake meets German Foreign Minister
byline: As part of the official visit to the Federal Republic of Germany, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake met with German Foreign Minister Dr. Johann Wadephul on Wednesday (11) at the Waldorf Astoria Hotel in Berlin.

title: Israeli fire kills 60 in Gaza, many near aid site, medics say
byline: Israeli gunfire and airstrikes killed at least 60 Palestinians in Gaza on Wednesday, most of them near an aid site operated by the U.S- and Israeli-backed Gaza Humanitarian Foundation in the centre of the enclave, local health officials said.

title: Heavy showers above 100mm expected in parts of the island
byline: Showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central, Southern and North-western provinces, the Department of Meteorology says.

title: Beach Boys founder Brian Wilson dies at age 82
byline: Beach Boys cofounder Brian Wilson, who created some of rock’s most enduring songs such as “Good Vibrations” and “God Only Knows” in a career that was marked by a decades-long battle between his musical genius, drug abuse and mental health issues, has died at the age of 82.

title: Sri Lanka ‘deeply saddened’ by tragic plane crash in Ahmedabad
byline: Sri Lanka has expressed condolences to the bereaved family members of the victims of the Air India plane crash in Ahmedabad this afternoon.

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: City police chief says there appears to be ‘no survivors’
byline: The police chief in Ahmedabad says there appears to be no survivors from the plane crash, according to reports from the AFP and AP news agencies.

title: 23-year-old killed in sword attack in Matugama
byline: A father and son have been attacked with a sword by another group in the Ambarullagahawatta area of Matugama, resulting in the son’s death.

title: Ahmedabad Plane Crash: Sri Lanka President condoles with families of victims
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has offered heartfelt condolences to the families of all those who were affected by the Air India plane crash near Ahmedabad today.

title: Audit be conducted on financial loss incurred due to train cancellations
byline: The Committee on Public Accounts (COPA) has recommended that an audit be conducted on the daily financial loss incurred due to train cancellations.

title: At least 20 feared dead in Air India flight crash in Ahmedabad
byline: At least 20 passengers have been feared dead in the deadly crash near Ahmedabad airport, according to reports from multiple Indian media outlets.

title: SJB secures power in Akurana PS
byline: The opposition, led by the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB), has secured power in the Akurana Pradeshiya Sabha.

title: Train operations restored on Kandy–Peradeniya line
byline: The section of the railway line between Kandy and Peradeniya stations which was affected due to ground subsidence has been repaired and train services restored, the Railway Department said.

title: 133 killed in Ahmedabad plane crash - Indian media
byline: At least 133 people were killed after an Air India flight crashed near the Ahmedabad airport on Thursday, according several Indian media outlets.

title: Student dead, 16 injured after tree falls on school building in Balangoda
byline: A student has died while 16 others have sustained injuries after a tree collapsed on to a school building in Balangoda, police stated.

title: Jagath Weerasinghe named new Prisons Media Spokesperson
byline: Prisons Commissioner Jagath Weerasinghe has been appointed the Media Spokesperson of the Department of Prisons.

title: National Animal Census report released
byline: The report of the National Animal Census conducted on March 15 has been published today (12).

title: New species of dinosaur discovered that ‘rewrites’ T.rex family tree
byline: Scientists have discovered a new species of dinosaur - in the collection of a Mongolian museum - that they say “rewrites” the evolutionary history of tyrannosaurs.

title: Air India plane with 242 on board crashes after takeoff at Ahmedabad airport
byline: An Air India Ahmedabad-London flight crashed at the Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International Airport in Ahmedabad during take-off, according to foreign media reports.

title: Prisons Media Spokesman tenders resignation
byline: Prison Media Spokesman, Commissioner Gamini B. Dissanayake, has reportedly tendered his resignation from the position of Prison Media Spokesperson to the Acting Commissioner General of Prisons.

title: Health Ministry warns of rising ‘rat fever’ cases
byline: The Epidemiology Unit of the Ministry of Health states that an increase in the number of Leptospirosis cases, also known as “rat fever,” has been observed across the country.

title: NPP member named chairman of Haldummulla PS
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) has secured the chairmanship of the Haldummulla Pradeshiya Sabha following a vote during the inaugural sitting today.

title: Bond scam case: CBSL Financial Intelligence Unit ordered to appear in court
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court today (12) ordered the Financial Intelligence Unit of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka to appear before court on December 11 and explain the failure to submit account reports related to investigations into the Central Bank bond scam, as previously ordered by court.

title: Two deaths reported due to Covid variant in Sri Lanka
byline: Two persons have reportedly died so far after being infected with the Covid variant currently spreading across the country.

title: 34 Police officers including OICs transferred and assigned to new positions
byline: A total of 34 Police officers including Officers-in-Charge (OICs) of Sri Lanka Police have been transferred and assigned to new positions with immediate effect.

title: US to pull some personnel from the Middle East amid rising tensions with Iran
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday U.S. personnel were being moved out of the Middle East because “it could be a dangerous place,” adding that the United States would not allow Iran to have a nuclear weapon.
